Here's the quick three-command sequence to record your latest changes (gTTS install + any code edits) and push them to GitHub.

bash © Copy

git add excuse_api.py requirements.txt
git commit -m "feat: voice output via gTTS; update requirements"

git push

After the push finishes, refresh your repo page—GitHub will show the new commit at the top of the history. That's it; your project
and dependencies are fully up to date online.
